text: // ICC CWC 2011 Final India vs SL
6:50pm IST Thanks Abhishek. Boy, that was the innings of the World Cup from Mahela!

6:50pm IST Thanks Abhishek. Boy, that was some innings from Mahela! The innings of the World Cup, possibly challenged only by KOB's blitz against England. Gilchrist and Ponting played classics in 2007 and 2003 finals... how good was this in comparison?
Sivabhaskar: "I've already started getting nightmares of a rain of in-swinging-yorkers -- Malinga !" and "A wicked kind of a compensation. Zaheer leaked at death what he contained at the birth."

Guru: "I know this is far-fetched, but think of it - Sachin getting his 100th 100 and winning the title for India, chasing a big total in a high-pressure final. How better can things get?" Well, so far this World Cup, India have managed to give their fans everything they wanted. This seems like the steepest demand of all, but who am I to bet against them pulling it off ...

Calvin: "I certainly don't see India getting these runs ,to win the world cup.As we can see there is some bounce in the wicket, which plays right into the hands of the Sri lankan's, bowlers." Debatable, Calvin. As far as I know, Sri Lanka's bowlers prefer slow and low pitches, not ones with good carry and little turn (which is how it has been so far). Plus, this is a small outfield. But, in a World Cup final, 274 is a mountain.
Mazher: "Mahela Jaywardene has never scored a century in losing cause, his all 13 centuries - before today - were match winning" Not sure if true, but if it is, that's a staggering stat ...

Swamy: "India's strategy has now been inverted thanks to that brilliant knock from Mahela. What happens in the first 15 overs will now dictate whether India win. Anything less than 100+ for no loss or 1 wicket means its SL's game."

Right, not much of a break. The players are out there. Sehwag is ready, Sachin's with him. The fielders are in position. Can Sehwag hit a first-ball four again? India need a lot of those. Won't be easy against Malinga. This is Nitin Sundar to start off commentary for the chase.
